entry.title: What are interesting parts of the Bitcoin Core codebase?
entry.summary:
Mempool design presents a set of unique theoretical challenges that have captured the interest of many within the field. The intricacies involved in ensuring incentive compatibility within mempools are vast and complex, offering a fertile ground for academic exploration and practical innovation alike. For those interested in delving deeper into this topic, a comprehensive summary can be found at [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/mempool-incentive-compatibility/553summary-18), which provides valuable insights into the various mechanisms and strategies that could potentially enhance the efficiency and fairness of mempool management.
In addition to the technical aspects of mempool design, the broader concerns surrounding privacy and resistance to denial-of-service (DoS) attacks in distributed networks also remain pertinent areas of ongoing research. These issues are critical not only for maintaining the integrity and functionality of blockchain technologies but also for ensuring the security and confidentiality of user transactions within these systems. An informative piece discussing potential vulnerabilities and countermeasures related to peer-to-peer network attacks can be found at [Bitcoin Core Academy](https://bitcoincore.academy/p2p-attacks.html), offering readers a detailed overview of the current landscape and emerging trends in the field.
The exploration of these topics underscores the dynamic and evolving nature of blockchain technology and its underlying components. As researchers and developers continue to navigate these challenges, the knowledge and solutions generated will undoubtedly contribute to the advancement and maturation of digital currencies and their associated ecosystems.
